member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.ExpressionParser
member.summary: Parses ABML expressions into AST nodes using Parlot.
member.remarks:
Grammar (precedence low to high):
expression = ternary ternary = nullCoalesce ("?" expression ":" expression)? nullCoalesce = or ("??" or)* or = and ("||" and)* and = equality ("&&" equality)* equality = comparison (("==" | "!=") comparison)* comparison = term (("<" | "<=" | ">" | ">=") term)* term = factor (("+" | "-") factor)* factor = unary (("*" | "/" | "%") unary)* unary = ("!" | "-") unary | membership membership = postfix ("in" postfix)? postfix = primary (("." IDENT) | ("[" expression "]") | ("?." IDENT) | ("?[" expression "]") | ("(" args ")"))* primary = "null" | "true" | "false" | NUMBER | STRING | arrayLiteral | IDENT | "(" expression ")" arrayLiteral = "[" (expression ("," expression)*)? "]"

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.ExpressionParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses an expression string into an AST.

member.summary: Tries to parse an expression string into an AST.
member.returns: True if parsing succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.Instruction.A
member.summary: Gets the A operand (usually destination register).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.Instruction.B
member.summary: Gets the B operand (source 1 or constant index).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.Instruction.C
member.summary: Gets the C operand (source 2 or constant index).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.Instruction.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an instruction from packed value.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.And
member.summary: R[A] = R[B] && R[C] (non-short-circuit, use jumps for short-circuit)

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.JumpIfTrue
member.summary: if R[A] is truthy then PC = (B << 8) | C

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.JumpIfFalse
member.summary: if R[A] is falsy then PC = (B << 8) | C

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.JumpIfNull
member.summary: if R[A] == null then PC = (B << 8) | C

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.JumpIfNotNull
member.summary: if R[A] != null then PC = (B << 8) | C

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.CallArgs
member.summary: Specifies arg count for following Call. A = argCount

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Compiler.OpCode.Call
member.summary: R[A] = Call(constants[B], args starting at R[C])
member.remarks: Must be preceded by CallArgs instruction that specifies arg count. B encodes function name index in constants. Args are in R[C], R[C+1], ..., R[C+argCount-1].

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Documents.Actions.ContinuationPointAction
member.summary: Continuation point for streaming composition. Allows extensions to attach during execution.

remarks.para: When execution reaches a continuation point: 1. If an extension is attached, control transfers to the extension 2. Otherwise, waits up to Timeout for an extension to arrive 3. If timeout expires, executes DefaultFlow
This enables streaming composition: game server receives complete cinematic, starts executing, and can optionally receive extensions mid-execution.

member.param: Unique name for this continuation point.
Maximum time to wait for extension (e.g., "2s", "500ms").
Flow to execute if no extension arrives.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Documents.Actions.ContinuationPointAction.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Continuation point for streaming composition. Allows extensions to attach during execution.

remarks.para: When execution reaches a continuation point: 1. If an extension is attached, control transfers to the extension 2. Otherwise, waits up to Timeout for an extension to arrive 3. If timeout expires, executes DefaultFlow
This enables streaming composition: game server receives complete cinematic, starts executing, and can optionally receive extensions mid-execution.

member.param: Unique name for this continuation point.
Maximum time to wait for extension (e.g., "2s", "500ms").
Flow to execute if no extension arrives.

Pattern:
\\$\\{([^}]+)\\}
Explanation:
Match the string "${".
1st capture group.
Match a character other than '}' atomically at least once.
Match '}'.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Abml.Execution.ValueEvaluator
member.summary: Utility for evaluating action parameter values. Handles the distinction between literal values and expression values.

remarks.para: Values containing ${...} are evaluated as expressions. Plain values are parsed as literals (numbers, booleans, null, or strings).

Examples:
"Hello" string "Hello"
"42" int 42
"3.14" double 3.14
"true" bool true
"null" null
"${x + 1}" evaluated expression result
"Hello ${name}" interpolated template result

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a numeric configuration property must be a multiple of a given value. Matches OpenAPI 3.0 validation keyword: multipleOf.

remarks.para: This attribute is generated from OpenAPI schema validation keywords and validated at startup by .

Use this for ensuring configuration values follow required increments, such as: - Timeouts in milliseconds (multiple of 1000 for whole seconds) - Percentage steps (multiple of 5 for 0%, 5%, 10%, etc.) - Currency precision (multiple of 0.01 for cents) - Buffer sizes (multiple of 1024 for KB boundaries)
For floating point values, a small tolerance is used to handle precision issues.

member.example:
Schema:
TimeoutMs: type: integer multipleOf: 1000 default: 5000
Generated:
[ConfigMultipleOf(1000)] public int TimeoutMs { get; set; } = 5000;

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.DefaultTolerance
member.summary: Default tolerance for floating point comparison.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.Factor
member.summary: The value that the property must be a multiple of.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.Tolerance
member.summary: Tolerance for floating point comparison. Defaults to 1e-9.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a multipleOf constraint with the specified factor.
member.param: The value that the property must be a multiple of. Must be positive and non-zero.
member.exception: Thrown when factor is zero or negative.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.IsValid(System.Double)
member.summary: Validates whether the given value is a multiple of .
member.returns: True if the value is a multiple of the factor; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigMultipleOfAttribute.GetMultipleOfDescription
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of this constraint.
member.returns: A string describing the required multiple.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a regex pattern constraint for a configuration property. Matches OpenAPI 3.0 validation keyword: pattern.

remarks.para: This attribute is generated from OpenAPI schema validation keywords and validated at startup by .
Use this for ensuring configuration strings match required formats, such as: - URL formats (^https?://) - Domain names - Email-like patterns - Environment-specific naming conventions
The pattern uses .NET regular expression syntax. The entire string must match the pattern (implicit anchoring is NOT applied - use ^ and $ if needed).

member.example:
Schema:
ServiceDomain: type: string pattern: "^https?://" default: "https://api.example.com"
Generated:
[ConfigPattern(@"^https?://", Description = "Must start with http:// or https://")] public string ServiceDomain { get; set; } = "https://api.example.com";

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.Pattern
member.summary: The regular expression pattern that the value must match.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.Description
member.summary: Optional human-readable description of what the pattern validates. Used in error messages to help users understand the expected format.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.MatchTimeout
member.summary: Timeout for regex matching to prevent ReDoS attacks from malicious patterns. Defaults to 1 second.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a pattern constraint with the specified regex pattern.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match against.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.CompiledRegex
member.summary: Gets a compiled regex for efficient repeated matching.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Validates whether the given string matches this pattern constraint.
member.param: The string value to validate. Null values are considered valid (use other validation for null checks).
member.returns: True if the value matches the pattern or is null; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigPatternAttribute.GetPatternDescription
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of this pattern constraint.
member.returns: The description if provided, otherwise the raw pattern.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies numeric range constraints for a configuration property. Matches OpenAPI 3.0 validation keywords: minimum, maximum, exclusiveMinimum, exclusiveMaximum.

remarks.para: This attribute is generated from OpenAPI schema validation keywords and validated at startup by .
Unlike , this attribute supports exclusive bounds (value must be strictly greater/less than the bound).
Use and sentinel values to indicate unbounded ranges, as C# doesn't allow nullable types in attribute parameters.

member.example:
Schema:
RtpEnginePort: type: integer minimum: 1 maximum: 65535
Generated:
[ConfigRange(Minimum = 1, Maximum = 65535)] public int RtpEnginePort { get; set; } = 22222;

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.NoMinimum
member.summary: Sentinel value indicating no minimum bound. Use in attribute: Minimum = ConfigRangeAttribute.NoMinimum

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.NoMaximum
member.summary: Sentinel value indicating no maximum bound. Use in attribute: Maximum = ConfigRangeAttribute.NoMaximum

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum allowed value (inclusive unless is true). Use (double.NegativeInfinity) for no lower bound.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum allowed value (inclusive unless is true). Use (double.PositiveInfinity) for no upper bound.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.ExclusiveMinimum
member.summary: If true, the value must be strictly greater than (not equal). Matches OpenAPI 3.0 exclusiveMinimum: true behavior.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.ExclusiveMaximum
member.summary: If true, the value must be strictly less than (not equal). Matches OpenAPI 3.0 exclusiveMaximum: true behavior.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a range constraint with no bounds (use named properties to set bounds).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a range constraint with inclusive minimum and maximum bounds.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.HasMinimum
member.summary: Returns true if a minimum bound is defined (not equal to ).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.HasMaximum
member.summary: Returns true if a maximum bound is defined (not equal to ).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.IsValid(System.Double)
member.summary: Validates whether the given value satisfies this range constraint.
member.returns: True if the value is within the allowed range; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRangeAttribute.GetRangeDescription
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of this range constraint.
member.returns: A string describing the allowed range.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigRequiredAttribute
member.summary: The configuration property is required for the service to function.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute
member.summary: Specifies string length constraints for a configuration property. Matches OpenAPI 3.0 validation keywords: minLength, maxLength.

remarks.para: This attribute is generated from OpenAPI schema validation keywords and validated at startup by .

Use this for ensuring configuration strings meet length requirements, such as: - JWT secrets (minimum 32 characters for security) - Salt values (minimum length for cryptographic strength) - Names and codes (maximum length for database constraints)
Use and sentinel values to indicate unbounded lengths, as C# doesn't allow nullable types in attribute parameters.

member.example:
Schema:
JwtSecret: type: string minLength: 32 maxLength: 512
Generated:
[ConfigStringLength(MinLength = 32, MaxLength = 512)] public string JwtSecret { get; set; } = "default-dev-secret-key-32-chars!";

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.NoMinLength
member.summary: Sentinel value indicating no minimum length. Use in attribute: MinLength = ConfigStringLengthAttribute.NoMinLength

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.NoMaxLength
member.summary: Sentinel value indicating no maximum length. Use in attribute: MaxLength = ConfigStringLengthAttribute.NoMaxLength

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum allowed string length (inclusive). Use (-1) for no lower bound.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum allowed string length (inclusive). Use (-1) for no upper bound.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a string length constraint with no bounds (use named properties to set bounds).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a string length constraint with minimum and maximum bounds.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.HasMinLength
member.summary: Returns true if a minimum length is defined (not equal to ).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.HasMaxLength
member.summary: Returns true if a maximum length is defined (not equal to ).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Validates whether the given string satisfies this length constraint.
member.param: The string value to validate. Null values are considered invalid if MinLength > 0.
member.returns: True if the string length is within the allowed range; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Attributes.ConfigStringLengthAttribute.GetLengthDescription
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of this length constraint.
member.returns: A string describing the allowed length range.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory
member.summary: Category of behavior layer in the stack.

remarks.para: Categories provide semantic grouping for behaviors. Within a category, layers are ordered by priority. Layers can be added/removed per category.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory.Base
member.summary: Fundamental behaviors shared by entity type (e.g., humanoid-base). Lowest priority - always present but easily overridden.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory.Cultural
member.summary: Cultural and regional behaviors (e.g., medieval-european). Influences speech patterns, gestures, social norms.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory.Professional
member.summary: Role-based behaviors (e.g., guard-patrol, merchant-trading). Defines primary occupation and default activities.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory.Personal
member.summary: Individual personality traits (e.g., afraid-of-spiders, cheerful). Personal quirks and emotional tendencies.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.BehaviorCategory.Situational
member.summary: Situational and temporary behaviors (e.g., combat-mode, fleeing). Highest priority - triggered by events or GOAP planning.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IntentContribution
member.summary: A contribution from a behavior layer to an intent channel.
member.param: The layer that produced this contribution.
The priority of the layer within its category.

member.summary: A contribution from a behavior layer to an intent channel.
member.param: The layer that produced this contribution.
The priority of the layer within its category.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IntentContribution.LayerId
member.summary: The layer that produced this contribution.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IntentContribution.LayerPriority
member.summary: The priority of the layer within its category.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IntentContribution.EffectivePriority
member.summary: Computes effective priority based on category and layer priority. Higher values win during merge.
member.remarks: Formula: (category * 1000) + layerPriority This ensures category always trumps layer priority within a category.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ICognitionBuilder
member.summary: Builds cognition pipelines from templates with optional character-specific overrides.

remarks.para: The builder applies overrides in order to produce a customized pipeline. Override priority (most to least common):

list.item: Parameter overrides - Modify handler parameters (weights, thresholds, etc.)
Disable overrides - Conditionally or unconditionally disable handlers
Replace overrides - Swap handler implementations (advanced, rare)

member.returns: The built pipeline, or null if template not found.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.CognitionTemplate
member.summary: A cognition pipeline template that defines the stages and handlers for processing perceptions into intentions.

remarks.para: Templates define the standard cognition pipeline structure:

list.item: Filter - Attention filtering based on priority weights
MemoryQuery - Query relevant memories
Significance - Assess perception significance
Storage - Store significant perceptions as memories
Intention - Evaluate goal impact and trigger replanning

remarks.para: Templates can be loaded from embedded resources or YAML files. Character-specific behavior is achieved through overrides applied at runtime.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.CognitionTemplate.Stages
member.summary: The ordered list of stages in this pipeline.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.CognitionStageDefinition
member.summary: Definition of a single stage in the cognition pipeline.
member.remarks: Each stage can contain multiple handlers that execute in order. The standard stages are: filter, memory_query, significance, storage, intention.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.CognitionStageDefinition.Handlers
member.summary: Ordered list of handlers in this stage.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ICutsceneCoordinator
member.summary: Coordinates multi-participant cutscenes across distributed clients.

remarks.para: The coordinator manages the server-side master timeline for cutscenes involving multiple players/entities across different clients.
Key responsibilities:

list.item: Track sync point progress across all participants
Create and manage input windows for QTEs and choices
Handle disconnection gracefully with defaults
Distribute cutscene state updates to all participants

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IDialogueResolver
member.summary: Resolves dialogue text through the three-step resolution pipeline: 1. Check external file for condition overrides 2. Check external file for localization 3. Fall back to inline default

remarks.para: Per FOUNDATION TENETS (G2 decision), every dialogue must have an inline default. External references are optional and provide localization and conditional overrides.

Example ABML usage:
- speak: character: "${npc.id}" text: "Welcome to my shop!" # Inline default (required) external: dialogue/merchant/greet # External reference (optional)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IDialogueResolver.ResolveAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.DialogueReference,BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.LocalizationContext,BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IDialogueExpressionContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolves dialogue text using the three-step resolution pipeline.
member.param: The dialogue reference containing inline and optional external.
Expression context for evaluating condition overrides.
member.returns: The resolved dialogue with source information.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IEntityResolver
member.summary: Resolves semantic binding names to entity references within cutscene contexts.

remarks.para: In ABML cutscenes, channels use semantic names like "hero" or "villain" rather than entity IDs. The entity resolver translates these names to actual entity references using the cutscene's bindings.
Resolution sources (in priority order):

list.item: Explicit bindings provided at cutscene start
Role-based resolution from participants
Expression context for dynamic bindings

member.param: Optional expression context for dynamic resolution.
member.returns: The resolved entity reference, or null if not found.

member.summary: Resolves multiple binding names at once.
member.param: Optional expression context for dynamic resolution.
member.returns: Dictionary of resolved references (missing bindings omitted).

member.summary: Checks if a binding name can be resolved.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.CutsceneBindings
member.summary: Entity bindings for a cutscene, mapping semantic names to entity references.

remarks.para: Bindings are provided when a cutscene starts to establish which entities fill which roles. This allows the same cutscene to be reused with different participants.
Standard binding categories:

list.item: Participants: Active characters (hero, villain, ally)
Props: Interactive objects (door, chest, weapon)
Locations: Named positions (center_stage, exit_point)

member.summary: Role assignments mapping semantic names to roles.
member.remarks: Roles provide semantic meaning for resolution priority. E.g., "protagonist" "hero", "antagonist" "villain"

remarks.para: When cinematics complete, they must sync their final state back to this registry so that subsequent behavior evaluations have accurate world knowledge.
Implementations must be thread-safe as state may be updated from multiple sources (cinematics completing, game server updates, perception events).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IExternalDialogueLoader
member.summary: Loads external dialogue files containing localizations and conditional overrides.

remarks.para:
External dialogue files are YAML documents with the following structure:
# dialogue/merchant/greet.yaml localizations: en: "Welcome to my shop!" es: "Bienvenido a mi tienda!" ja: ""
overrides: - condition: "${player.reputation > 50}" text: "Ah, my favorite customer!" priority: 10 - condition: "${time.hour >= 20}" text: "We're about to close, but come in!" priority: 5

Resolution order per G2 decision: 1. Check overrides (highest priority matching condition wins) 2. Check localizations (for current locale with fallback) 3. Fall back to inline default (from ABML document)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.IInputWindowManager
member.summary: Manages input windows for player/behavior input during cutscenes.

remarks.para: Input windows represent moments where specific participants can provide input. The "blue/red/gray box" mental model from THE DREAM:

list.item: Blue box: Your turn to input (you're the target)
Red box: Their turn (waiting for another participant)
Gray box: No input allowed (e.g., reading text)

remarks.para: All input is server-adjudicated - client input is a "suggestion" that may be accepted, modified, or replaced by timeout defaults.

member.returns: The window, or null if not found or expired.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ISyncPointManager
member.summary: Manages synchronization points for multi-participant cutscenes.

remarks.para: Sync points allow multiple ABML channels (each potentially on different clients) to coordinate their execution. When any channel reaches a sync point:

list.item: That channel pauses execution
Server tracks which participants have reached
Once all participants reach, server releases all to continue

remarks.para: This enables cross-entity coordination like:

list.item: Hero attacks villain reacts (villain waits for hero)
Camera shake after impact (camera waits for attack to land)
Dialogue choice other player responds (both synchronized)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ISyncPointManager.RegisterSyncPoint(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet{System.Guid},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Registers a sync point that will be used in this session.
member.param: Participants that must reach this point (null = all).

member.summary: Reports that a participant has reached a sync point.
member.param: The entity that reached the point.
member.returns: The sync point status after this report.

member.summary: Waits for all participants to reach a sync point.

member.returns: The sync point status, or null if not registered.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager
member.summary: Manages temporal desync for multiplayer cutscenes.

remarks.para: This interface defines the contract for THE DREAM's "three-version solution" where participants experience time dilation during QTE sequences while spectators see real-time playback.
Key concepts:

list.item: Time Budget: Participants "earn" slow-mo time by fast-forwarding through setup
Time Dilation: Applied during QTE sections to extend reaction windows
Spectator View: Unaffected by time dilation (sees real-time)

remarks.para: Implementation note: This is a game engine concern. The ABML/behavior system marks time-gain and QTE sections; the game engine implements the actual time dilation. This interface provides the integration point.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.AddTimeBudget(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds time budget to a participant.
member.remarks: Called when a participant fast-forwards through a time-gain section (e.g., walking to the arena entrance). The "saved" time is added to their slow-mo budget for later QTE sections.
member.param: Amount of time budget to add.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.SpendTimeBudget(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Spends time budget for a participant.
member.remarks: Called when a participant uses slow-mo during a QTE section. The amount spent is deducted from their budget.
member.param: Amount of time budget to spend.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.GetTimeBudget(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the current time budget for a participant.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.GetTimeDilation(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the current time dilation for an entity.

remarks.para: Time dilation values:

list.item: 1.0 = Normal time (no dilation)
0.1 = 10x slow-mo (participant has budget, in QTE section)
2.0 = 2x fast-forward (participant in time-gain section)

remarks.para: Spectators always return 1.0 (real-time playback).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.IsParticipant(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks if an entity is currently a participant in a temporal session.
member.returns: True if the entity is a participant (can experience dilation).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.RegisterParticipant(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Registers an entity as a participant in temporal desync.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.UnregisterParticipant(System.Guid)
member.summary: Unregisters an entity from temporal desync.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.EnterTimeGainSection(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Enters a time-gain section for a participant.
member.remarks: During time-gain sections, participants fast-forward through content (e.g., walking sequences) to "earn" slow-mo budget for later QTEs.
member.param: Maximum time that can be gained in this section.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.ExitTimeGainSection(System.Guid)
member.summary: Exits a time-gain section for a participant.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.ITemporalManager.EnterQteSection(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan,System.Single)
member.summary: Enters a QTE section where time budget can be spent.
member.param: The actual window duration without slow-mo.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Behavior.NullTemporalManager
member.summary: Null implementation of temporal manager for when temporal desync is disabled.
member.remarks:
Use this implementation when:
Single-player mode (no temporal desync needed)
Game engine doesn't support temporal desync
Testing without temporal features
All time dilations return 1.0 (normal time).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientEventNormalizer
member.summary:
Normalizes client event names from their potentially mangled form (from JSON serialization) back to canonical whitelist format.
NSwag/JsonStringEnumConverter converts event names like "system.notification" to "system_notification" or "System_notification". This class maps these mangled names back to their canonical form for: 1. Validation against the whitelist 2. Rewriting the event_name in the payload before sending to clients

member.summary: Attempts to normalize an event name from its potentially mangled form to canonical form.
member.param: The event name as received (possibly mangled, e.g., "system_notification")
member.returns: True if the event is valid and was normalized, false if not in whitelist

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientEventNormalizer.IsValidEventName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if an event name (possibly mangled) is valid according to the whitelist.
member.returns: True if valid (in whitelist), false otherwise

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientEventNormalizer.NormalizeEventPayload(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Normalizes the event_name field in a JSON payload to its canonical form. If the event is not in the whitelist, returns null.
member.returns: Tuple of (canonicalEventName, normalizedPayload) if valid, or (null, originalPayload) if event not in whitelist or parsing fails

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.IClientEventPublisher
member.summary: Interface for publishing events to specific WebSocket clients via session-specific channels. Services use this to push events to clients without knowing which Connect instance handles them.

remarks.para: Events are published to RabbitMQ topics named CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId}. The Connect service subscribes to these topics and forwards events to the appropriate WebSocket.

IMPORTANT - Connect-Internal Events: Some events (ShortcutPublishedEvent, ShortcutRevokedEvent) are consumed by Connect internally and NOT forwarded to the WebSocket client. Connect updates its internal state and sends an updated capability manifest to the client instead. Clients never see these raw events - they only see the resulting manifest changes.
All events must have a valid eventName that exists in the ClientEventWhitelist. Events with invalid names will be rejected by the publisher.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.IClientEventPublisher.PublishToSessionAsync``1(System.String,``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Publishes an event to a specific client session.
member.typeparam: Type of client event (must inherit from BaseClientEvent).
member.returns: True if the event was published successfully, false otherwise.
member.exception: Thrown if the event name is not in the whitelist.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.IClientEventPublisher.PublishToSessionsAsync``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Publishes an event to multiple client sessions.
member.typeparam: Type of client event (must inherit from BaseClientEvent).
member.returns: The number of sessions the event was successfully published to.
member.exception: Thrown if the event name is not in the whitelist.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.IClientEventPublisher.IsValidEventName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if an event name is valid (exists in the whitelist).
member.returns: True if the event name is valid.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.MessageBusClientEventPublisher
member.summary: Message bus implementation of IClientEventPublisher. Publishes client events to session-specific RabbitMQ queues via MassTransit.

remarks.para: Uses a dedicated direct exchange ("bannou-client-events") with routing keys to deliver events only to the target session's queue. The routing key is the queue name (CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId}).

This architecture ensures: - No per-session exchange proliferation (single shared direct exchange) - Efficient broker-level message filtering (only matching queues receive events) - Clean separation from service events which use the "bannou" fanout exchange

The Connect service uses direct RabbitMQ to subscribe because MassTransit doesn't support dynamic runtime queue creation. Session queues have 5-minute TTL applied via RabbitMQ policy for automatic cleanup.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.MessageBusClientEventPublisher.SESSION_TOPIC_PREFIX
member.summary: Prefix for session-specific queue names and routing keys.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.MessageBusClientEventPublisher.CLIENT_EVENTS_EXCHANGE
member.summary: The dedicated direct exchange for client events. Defined in provisioning/rabbitmq/definitions.json.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.MessageBusClientEventPublisher.GetEventName``1(``0)
member.summary: Extracts the event name from a client event, handling NSwag-generated enum shadowing.

remarks.para: NSwag generates derived event classes that shadow the base Event_name (string) property with an enum property (e.g., CapabilityManifestEventEvent_name). When accessing Event_name via the BaseClientEvent constraint, we get the base string property which may be unset.
This method uses reflection to find the actual Event_name property on the runtime type and extracts the correct string value, handling EnumMember attributes for enum values.

member.typeparam: The event type.
member.returns: The event name string, or null if not found.

Sent to client when their available API capabilities change.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
Unique GUID for peer-to-peer routing on this Connect node.
Other connections on the same Connect node can route messages directly
to this connection using this GUID with the Client flag (0x20).
Enables zero-copy message forwarding between Game Servers, Actor Pool Nodes, and clients.
Note: Only valid while connected to the same Connect instance.

If an env var sets a non-nullable string to empty, that's a configuration error - schema provides the default, so the only way to get empty is explicit override to empty string.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.StatusCodes
member.summary: An enumeration of possible API response codes returned by this service.

remarks.para: IMPORTANT: Use this enum (BeyondImmersion.BannouService.StatusCodes), NOT Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.StatusCodes which is a static class with int constants.
All service methods return (StatusCodes, TResponse?) tuples. See TENETS.md T8: Return Pattern for usage requirements.

WARNING - DO NOT ADD NEW STATUS CODES WITHOUT EXPLICIT APPROVAL. These codes are hand-chosen per TENET T8 to minimize client complexity. Adding new codes requires updating: Controller.liquid template, ErrorResponses.cs, client SDK ResponseCodes, and all consuming code. If you think you need a new status code, the answer is almost always "use an existing code with appropriate payload content to indicate the specific condition."

member.summary: Service temporarily unavailable (503). Used when a required dependency or subsystem is not available.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry
member.summary: Static registry mapping topic names to event types. Required because IEventConsumer handlers are stored as object-typed delegates.

remarks.para: The IEventConsumer stores handlers as Func<IServiceProvider, object, Task> - type information is lost after registration. This registry provides the topictype mapping needed by NativeEventConsumerBackend to deserialize incoming messages.

IMPORTANT: This registry MUST be populated before NativeEventConsumerBackend starts. Use the auto-generated EventSubscriptionRegistration.RegisterAll() method during application startup, or manually register event types in plugin initialization.
This class is thread-safe and supports idempotent registration.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry.Register``1(System.String)
member.summary: Register a topiceventType mapping. Called during service initialization (before subscriptions start).
member.typeparam: The event type for this topic
member.remarks: Registration is idempotent - registering the same topic multiple times with the same type is safe. However, registering a topic with a different type will overwrite the previous mapping and log a warning.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry.GetEventType(System.String)
member.summary: Get the event type for a topic, or null if not registered.
member.returns: The registered event type, or null if not registered

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry.Count
member.summary: Get the count of registered topictype mappings.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry.IsRegistered(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a topic is registered.
member.returns: True if the topic has a registered event type

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.EventSubscriptionRegistry.Clear
member.summary: Clear all registrations. For testing purposes only.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IEventConsumer
member.summary: Service for registering and dispatching Bannou pub/sub events across all plugins. This provides an application-level fan-out layer on top of RabbitMQ's topic routing limitation.

remarks.para: RabbitMQ only allows ONE consumer group to subscribe to a topic per app-id. When multiple plugins want to handle the same event, only one receives it. This service solves that by:

list.item: Having generated controllers push events into this singleton service
Dispatching to ALL registered handlers across all plugins
Isolating handler failures so one throwing doesn't prevent others from running

remarks.para: Registration uses a factory pattern to avoid capturing stale service instances. When dispatching, fresh service instances are resolved from the request scope.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IEventConsumer.Register``1(System.String,System.String,System.Func{System.IServiceProvider,``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Registers an event handler for a specific topic.
member.typeparam: The event type to handle.
member.param: Unique key to prevent duplicate registrations (e.g., "permissions:session.connected").
Factory that takes IServiceProvider and event, resolves the service, and calls the handler. The factory should resolve services from the provided scope, not capture constructor instances.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IEventConsumer.DispatchAsync``1(System.String,``0,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Dispatches an event to all registered handlers for the topic.
member.typeparam: The event type.
member.param: The DI scope for the current request (used to resolve services).
member.returns: Task that completes when all handlers have been invoked.
member.remarks: Handler failures are logged but do not prevent other handlers from running. All handlers are invoked even if some throw exceptions.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IEventConsumer.GetRegisteredTopics
member.summary: Gets all registered topic names for diagnostic purposes.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IEventConsumer.GetHandlerCount(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the number of handlers registered for a topic.

member.summary:
Published periodically by Orchestrator as the authoritative source of truth
for all service-to-app-id mappings across the entire network.
Consumed by all bannou instances to atomically update their routing tables.
Published every 30 seconds AND immediately when routing changes.

member.summary: Complete dictionary of serviceName -> appId mappings

member.summary: Monotonically increasing version for ordering. Consumers reject events with version <= current.

member.summary: Orchestrator instance GUID that published this event

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.TotalServices
member.summary: Total number of services in the mappings dictionary

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket connection is fully established.
This event ensures the RabbitMQ exchange exists before any service publishes
to the session-specific topic (CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId}).
Permission service uses this to track activeConnections and compile capabilities.
The roles and authorizations enable event-driven capability compilation without
synchronous API calls from Connect to Permission.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID that just connected via WebSocket

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.Roles
member.summary: User roles from JWT (e.g., ["user", "admin"]). Used by Permission to compile capabilities.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.Authorizations
member.summary: Authorization states from JWT (e.g., ["my-game:authorized"]). Format is "serviceId:state".

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.ConnectInstanceId
member.summary: Connect service instance handling this connection (for debugging)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
Unique GUID for peer-to-peer routing. Other connections on the same Connect node
can route messages directly to this connection using this GUID with the Client flag.
Enables zero-copy message forwarding between Game Servers, Actor Pool Nodes, and clients.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket connection is closed.
Used by Permission service to remove session from activeConnections.
Also enables cleanup of session-specific resources across services.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.Reconnectable
member.summary: Whether session can reconnect within the reconnection window

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.DurationSeconds
member.summary: How long the session was connected (for metrics)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket session is restored after reconnection.
Services should subscribe to this event to re-publish any session shortcuts they
previously granted, as shortcuts are cleared on disconnect and do not persist.
**Session Shortcuts Re-publication:**
Services that publish session shortcuts should listen for this event and re-evaluate
whether the session should receive shortcuts again (e.g., check subscription status,
game state, etc.) and publish new ShortcutPublishedEvents as appropriate.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.AccountId
member.summary: Account ID owning the reconnected session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.Roles
member.summary: User roles preserved from previous session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.Authorizations
member.summary: Authorization states preserved from previous session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.PreviousDisconnectAt
member.summary: When the previous connection was lost

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
New peer GUID for this reconnected session. Note: This is a NEW GUID -
peer GUIDs do not persist across reconnections. Peers must be notified
of the new GUID to continue peer-to-peer routing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.ReconnectionContext
member.summary: Optional context from the reconnection (client info, etc.)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent
member.summary:
Published by Actor service when an actor updates a character's behavioral state.
Game servers subscribe to receive state updates for characters they manage.
This is NOT physics data (position, velocity) - that's Game Server territory.
This is intent/emotional/goal state that the character's behavior stack reads as input.
Note: Game servers have no knowledge of actors - they only see character state.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.ActorId
member.summary: Actor that produced this update (opaque to Game Server)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.Feelings
member.summary: Emotional state values for the character

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.BehaviorChange
member.summary: Changes to the character's behavior composition

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState
member.summary:
Emotional state values (0.0 - 1.0 intensity).
The character's behavior stack reads these as inputs to influence decisions.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.GoalState
member.summary:
Goal state for the character.
Primary goal drives major decisions, secondary goals run in background.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.GoalState.GoalParameters
member.summary: Parameters for the primary goal (e.g., target entity, location)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.MemoryUpdate

A single memory update operation (add, remove, or modify).

member.summary: Memory value (entity ID, context, intensity, etc.)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ExtensionMethods.REGEX_InvalidChars
member.remarks:
Pattern:
[^a-zA-Z0-9\\s-]
Explanation:
Match a character in the set [^-0-9A-Za-z\s].

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ExtensionMethods.REGEX_Spaces
member.remarks:
Pattern:
\\s
Explanation:
Match a whitespace character.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ExtensionMethods.REGEX_MultipleSpaces
member.remarks:
Pattern:
\\s+
Explanation:
Match a whitespace character atomically at least once.

member.summary: Inject a perception event into an actor's queue (testing)
member.remarks:
Injects a perception event directly into the actor's perception queue
for testing purposes. Useful for testing actor behavior without a
full game server setup.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.IActorClient.QueryOptionsAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Query an actor for its available options
member.remarks:
Query an actor for its available options (combat, dialogue, exploration, etc.).
Options are maintained by the actor in its state and returned based on requested
freshness level. This enables Event Brain actors to ask participants "what can
you do?" for choreography and coordination.
Freshness levels:
- fresh: Inject context and wait for actor to recompute options
- cached: Return cached options if within maxAgeMs, else recompute
- stale_ok: Return cached options regardless of age

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.IActorClient.StartEncounterAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.StartEncounterRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Start an encounter managed by an Event Brain actor
member.remarks:
Initializes an encounter with the specified participants. The Event Brain actor
will coordinate the encounter, sending instructions to participant NPC Brain actors
via their character perception channels.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.IActorClient.UpdateEncounterPhaseAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.UpdateEncounterPhaseRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Update the phase of an active encounter
member.remarks:
Updates the phase of an encounter being managed by an Event Brain actor.
Phase changes are logged and can trigger behavior changes in participant actors.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.IActorClient.EndEncounterAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.EndEncounterRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Ends an encounter being managed by an Event Brain actor. This clears the
encounter state and allows the actor to manage a new encounter.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.IActorClient.GetEncounterAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.GetEncounterRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Get the current encounter state for an actor
member.remarks:
Retrieves the current encounter state for an Event Brain actor. Returns
null encounter data if the actor is not managing an encounter.

member.summary:
Regex pattern for actor IDs that trigger auto-spawn.
Examples: "npc-.*" matches "npc-grok", "npc-merchant-123"

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.AutoSpawnConfig.CharacterIdCaptureGroup
member.summary:
1-based regex capture group index for extracting CharacterId from actor ID.
Example: With idPattern "npc-brain-([a-f0-9-]+)" and characterIdCaptureGroup: 1,
actor ID "npc-brain-abc-123-def" extracts "abc-123-def" as CharacterId (parsed as GUID).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData
member.summary:
Data representing a perception event for an actor.
Spatial context can be provided in two ways (hybrid approach):
1. Typed: Use the optional spatialContext field for structured spatial data
2. Schema-less: Use perceptionType="spatial" with data containing spatial info
The typed approach is recommended when game server has structured spatial data.
The schema-less approach allows flexibility for game-specific spatial formats.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData.PerceptionType
member.summary:
Perception type. Common values: visual, auditory, tactile, olfactory,
proprioceptive, spatial. Use "spatial" for schema-less spatial data in 'data' field.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData.SourceId
member.summary: ID of the entity causing this perception

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData.SourceType
member.summary: Type of source (character, npc, object, environment, coordinator, scheduled, message)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData.Data
member.summary:
Perception-specific data. For perceptionType="spatial", this can contain
game-specific spatial context in any format the game server defines.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.PerceptionData.SpatialContext
member.summary:
Optional typed spatial context from game server's local spatial state.
Provides structured information about terrain, nearby objects, hazards, etc.
Alternative to using perceptionType="spatial" with schema-less data.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext
member.summary:
Spatial context derived from game server's authoritative spatial state.
Included in perception events to give NPC actors awareness of their environment
without requiring direct map subscriptions.
Note: additionalProperties=true allows game-specific extensions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext.TerrainType
member.summary: Terrain type at character position (grass, stone, water, etc.)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext.PathableDirections
member.summary: Directions the character can move (for navigation awareness)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext.CoverNearby
member.summary: Whether cover is available within close range

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext.Indoors
member.summary: Whether character is currently indoors/under roof

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.SpatialContext.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.summary: Distance from character in game units

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.NearbyObject.Direction

member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.InjectPerceptionResponse.Queued
member.summary: Whether the perception was successfully queued

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.InjectPerceptionResponse.QueueDepth
member.summary: Current depth of the perception queue

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest
member.summary:
Query an actor for its available options. Options are maintained by the actor
in its state.memories.{queryType}_options and returned based on requested freshness.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest.ActorId
member.summary: ID of the actor to query

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest.Freshness
member.summary:
Requested freshness level. Defaults to 'cached'.
- fresh: Inject context and wait for actor to recompute
- cached: Return cached options if within maxAgeMs
- stale_ok: Return whatever is cached, even if expired

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest.MaxAgeMs
member.summary:
Maximum age of cached options in milliseconds (for 'cached' freshness).
Defaults to 5000ms. If cached options are older, behavior depends on
freshness level.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsRequest.Context
member.summary:
Optional context for the query. When provided with freshness='fresh',
this context is injected as a perception to the actor, triggering
context-sensitive option recomputation.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsResponse
member.summary: Response containing the actor's available options

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsResponse.Options
member.summary: Available options for the queried type

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsResponse.ComputedAt
member.summary: When these options were last computed by the actor

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsResponse.AgeMs
member.summary: Age of options in milliseconds (now - computedAt)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.QueryOptionsResponse.CharacterContext
member.summary:
Character-specific context that influenced these options.
Only present for character-based actors.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryType
member.summary:
Type of options to query. Actors maintain options in state.memories.{type}_options.
Well-known types are defined; actors can also expose custom types.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsFreshness
member.summary: Controls caching behavior for options queries

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption
member.summary:
A single option available to the actor. The standardized fields enable
Event Brain to reason about options; additional fields allow actor-specific data.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.ActionId
member.summary:
Unique identifier for this action within the option type.
Examples: "sword_slash", "greet_friendly", "climb_wall"

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.Preference
member.summary:
How much the actor prefers this option (0-1), based on personality,
combat preferences, current state, etc. Higher = more preferred.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.Risk
member.summary: Estimated risk of this action (0=safe, 1=very risky)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.Available
member.summary: Whether this option is currently available (requirements met)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.Requirements
member.summary: Requirements that must be met for this option

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.CooldownMs
member.summary: Milliseconds until this option becomes available again (if on cooldown)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ActorOption.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext
member.summary:
Context provided with a fresh query. Injected as a perception to the actor
to trigger context-sensitive option recomputation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.CombatState
member.summary: Current combat state (approaching, engaged, retreating, etc.)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.OpponentIds
member.summary: IDs of opponents in the current encounter

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.AllyIds
member.summary: IDs of allies in the current encounter

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.EnvironmentTags
member.summary: Environment tags (indoor, elevated, destructibles, narrow, etc.)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.Urgency
member.summary: How urgent is this query (affects option prioritization)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.OptionsQueryContext.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.CharacterOptionContext
member.summary: Character-specific context that influenced option computation

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.CharacterOptionContext.CombatStyle
member.summary: Character's combat style (aggressive, defensive, balanced, etc.)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction
member.summary:
Instruction sent to a participant actor by Event Brain to execute a choreographed sequence.
Delivered via emit_perception with perception_type "choreography_instruction".

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.EncounterId
member.summary: ID of the coordinated encounter this instruction belongs to

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.SequenceId
member.summary:
Unique ID for this sequence within the choreography.
Used for acknowledgment and sync point coordination.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.Actions
member.summary:
Ordered list of actions for the participant to execute.
Multiple actions allow for combos or reaction sequences.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.Timing
member.summary: When and how to start executing this sequence

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.Priority
member.summary:
How strongly to prefer this choreography over actor's own choices.
Higher priority may interrupt current actions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.CanInterrupt
member.summary:
Whether participant can interrupt the sequence if a better opportunity arises.
If false, participant should complete the sequence unless impossible.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.ExpectedOutcome
member.summary:
Expected outcome of this sequence (e.g., "hit", "miss", "block").
Used for coordinating reactions with other participants.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyInstruction.OnComplete
member.summary:
Event to emit when sequence completes (e.g., "sync_point.attack_landed").
Other participants may be waiting on this.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction
member.summary:
A single action within a choreographed sequence.
ActionId should match one from the participant's options.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.ActionId
member.summary:
Action identifier matching one from the actor's options.
Examples: "sword_slash", "dodge_roll", "taunt"

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.TargetId
member.summary:
Target actor ID for the action, if applicable.
Null for untargeted actions like movement or taunts.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.Position
member.summary: Target position for movement or placement actions

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.DurationMs
member.summary:
Expected duration in milliseconds.
Used for timing subsequent actions and sync points.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.Style
member.summary:
Stylistic modifier for the action (e.g., "dramatic", "desperate", "confident").
Actors may adjust animation/presentation based on style.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.DelayMs
member.summary:
Delay before starting this action (relative to previous action completion).
Allows precise timing within sequences.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyAction.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets additional properties not defined in the schema.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyTiming
member.summary: Controls when a choreographed sequence should begin execution

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyTiming.StartAt
member.summary:
When to start executing the sequence.
- immediate: Start as soon as instruction received
- after_previous: Start after current action completes
- sync_point: Wait for specified sync point event

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyTiming.SyncPointId
member.summary:
Sync point to wait for (required when startAt=sync_point).
Examples: "attack_landed", "guard_raised", "combo_ready"

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyTiming.MaxWaitMs
member.summary:
Maximum time to wait for sync point in milliseconds.
If exceeded, sequence may start anyway or be cancelled.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyTiming.WindowMs
member.summary:
Time window during which the action can start.
Allows for natural timing variation.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyPriority
member.summary:
How strongly the actor should prefer the choreographed action over their own choices.
- low: Suggestion; actor may ignore if they prefer something else
- normal: Standard choreography; follow unless clearly suboptimal
- high: Important sequence; should follow even if not preferred
- override: Critical moment; must follow unless physically impossible

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyStartCondition
member.summary: When to begin executing a choreographed sequence

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Actor.ChoreographyPosition
member.summary: 3D position for choreography movement and placement actions

member.summary: ID of the Event Brain actor to query

member.summary: Whether the actor is currently managing an encounter

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient
member.summary: Client interface for the Analytics service. Provides strongly-typed methods for invoking service endpoints via the mesh infrastructure.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.IngestEventAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IngestEventRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
High-throughput event ingestion endpoint for recording game events.
Events are buffered in memory and periodically flushed to persistent storage.
Service-only endpoint - not exposed to clients.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.IngestEventBatchAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IngestEventBatchRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Batch event ingestion for high-volume scenarios. Accepts up to 1000 events per request.
Service-only endpoint - not exposed to clients.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.GetEntitySummaryAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.GetEntitySummaryRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Retrieve aggregated statistics for an entity. Summaries include total counts,
averages, and derived metrics computed from ingested events.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.QueryEntitySummariesAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.QueryEntitySummariesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Query multiple entity summaries with filtering and sorting options.
Useful for dashboards and reporting.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.GetSkillRatingAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.GetSkillRatingRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Retrieve the current Glicko-2 skill rating for an entity.
Returns rating, rating deviation (RD), and volatility.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.UpdateSkillRatingAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.UpdateSkillRatingRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Update entity skill rating after match
member.remarks:
Update skill ratings for entities after a match result.
Uses Glicko-2 algorithm to compute new ratings based on outcomes.
Service-only endpoint - typically called by game-session service.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.RecordControllerEventAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.RecordControllerEventRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Record when an account takes or releases control of an entity.
Used for tracking which player controlled which character/actor at what time.
Service-only endpoint.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.QueryControllerHistoryAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.QueryControllerHistoryRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Query who controlled what entity during a time range.
Useful for audit trails and replays.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.IAnalyticsClient.CleanupControllerHistoryAsync(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Analytics.CleanupControllerHistoryRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Deletes controller history records older than the configured retention period.
Runs in batches to avoid overwhelming the database. Returns count of deleted records.

member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Request upload URL for a new asset
member.remarks:

For large files (>50MB), returns multipart upload configuration.

member.summary: Mark upload as complete, trigger processing
member.remarks:
Called after the client has uploaded the file to the pre-signed URL.
Triggers the asset processing pipeline (texture conversion, model validation, etc.)
and emits completion events via WebSocket.

member.summary: Get asset metadata and download URL
member.remarks:
Retrieve asset metadata and generate a pre-signed download URL.
Specify version to download a specific version, or omit for latest.

member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.remarks:
Delete an asset from storage. If versionId is specified, only that version is deleted.
If versionId is omitted, all versions are deleted.

member.summary: List all versions of an asset
member.remarks:
Retrieve version history for an asset with pagination.
